API Documentation¶

Camera Interface¶

from pywfom.imaging import Camera

cam = Camera('webcam', 0) # Create webcam camera interface

cam.set(height=550, width=450, framerate=15.0) # Establish settings

print(cam.read()) # Print current frame

cam.close() # Close camera
class pywfom.imaging.Camera(device='test', index=0, **kwargs)¶

A Camera Interface for the PyWFOM System

Parameters

  • device (string) -- Type of camera

  • index (int) -- Index of the camera

close()¶

Closes the Camera Interface

get(setting=None)¶

Gets the current value of the specified setting

Parameters

setting (string) -- Setting value to be returned

get_max(setting)¶

Gets the maximum value of the specified setting

Parameters

setting (string) -- Maximum setting to be returned

get_min(setting)¶

Gets the minimum value of the specified setting

Parameters

setting (string) -- Minimum setting to be returned

read()¶

Read and return Camera's latest frame as a numpy array

set(**kwargs)¶

Establish camera settings either by including a configuration dictionary, or setting individual keyword arguments.

Parameters

  • config (dict) -- Dictionary containing multiple settings

  • device (string) -- Device type for the new Camera object.

  • name (string) -- (optional) Names the Camera object.

  • index (int) -- Sets the index Camera will connect to.

  • height (int) -- Sets the height of the Camera frame.

  • width (int) -- Sets the width of the Camera frame.

  • offset_x (int) -- Sets the width of the Camera frame.

  • offset_y (int) -- Sets the width of the Camera frame.

  • binning (string) -- Sets the binning of the Camera frame.

  • dtype (string) -- Sets the datatype of the Camera frame.

  • master (bool) -- Establishes whether Camera is self-triggered.

  • framerate (float) -- Sets the framerate the Camera read at

pywfom.imaging.error_frame(msg='')¶

Create an error frame displaying a specified message.

Parameters

msg (string) -- Message to be displayed on the error frame

pywfom.imaging.loading_frame(height=500, width=500)¶

Create a temporary frame displaying a 'loading' message.

Parameters

  • height (int) -- Height of the loading frame (in pixels)

  • width (int) -- Width of the loading frame (in pixels)

Arduino Interface¶

from pywfom.control import Arduino, list_ports

ports = list_ports() # Gather a list of available COM ports

port, name = ports[0] # Select the first port

ard = Arduino(port=port) # Connect to Arduino at specified port

ard.toggle_led(5) # Turn on LED at pin 5
class pywfom.control.Arduino(port='COM1', **kwargs)¶

Methods pertaining to Communication with the Arduino

toggle_led(pin)¶

Turn on a specified LED

toggle_strobing()¶

Toggles strobing on the connected LEDs

pywfom.control.list_ports()¶

Return a 2-item list of available COM Ports and their devices

Available GUI's¶

class pywfom.viewing.Config(parent, config)¶
class pywfom.viewing.Main(parent, system)¶

Monitor camera frames, Arduino status, and set file directory
